snippet.title: Facts about the Osprey
snippet.content: FACTS ABOUT THE MV-22 OSPREY: * Built by Boeing Co and Textron Inc's Bell Helicopter * called a tilt-rotor aircraft * can take off vertically like a helicopter and land on the decks of ships but has has two propellers that allow it to fly like a plane * during its testing phase between 1991 and 2000, there have been 30 fatalities, including that of 23 Marines during flight testing in 2000 * since becoming operational in 2007, there have been five crashes * Dick Cheney reported trying to cancel the development of the aircraft four times as Secretary of Defence * each unit costs an estimated $72 million * was branded "a flying shame" by Time Magazine upon its launch due to concerns it was unsafe and could not shoot straight RECENT INCIDENTS INVOLVING THE OSPREY: JANUARY 2017 - three US soldiers are hurt in the "hard landing" of an Osprey in Yemen DECEMBER 2016 - US grounds its Osprey fleet in Japan after one aircraft ditched in the sea, injuring its crew of five when a hose connected to the aircraft broke during a refuelling exercise 2015 - a US Osprey crashes during a training exercise in Hawaii, killing two marines.
